website_summaries.verdict: This fast BMX bike is designed for racing, and combines a lightweight design with sturdy construction for showing off your skills. It won't break your budget either.
pros: An affordable, well-made bike with a durable frame
Easy to assemble, making it practically ready to hit the track as soon as it arrives
Lightweight construction makes it speedy and almost effortless to maneuver
cons: If your are over 5 foot 8 inches tall, it may not work for you

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a BMX pro racing bike without breaking the bank. I am beyond impressed with this bike. I would recommend this bike to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: As someone with two decades in the sport of BMX, both freestyle and racing, but nearly 10 years off the track. I finally got the urge to get back onto the track. Searching around the current offerings on the market I wasn't too excited to find there was a large gap between the cheapy-cheapy & higher end completes. With some research under my belt I settled on the Title Elite XL. For the money, it's a great bike. The parts seem quality, but the frame stands out as super nice. I've upgraded a lot of parts since I purchased, but the foundation of the frame still feels solid and much like a higher quality frame.
customer_reviews.author: Chris  Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Add oversized rear axle washers
customer_reviews.text: Light, stiff, fast good handling. Either buy axle adjusters or oversized washers...or go insane as the rear wheel will continuously slide forward. I put a Thomson Elite seat post on it as the original is super short and useless. Took it to the track and I had the only one there, lots of the cheaper blue ones though. Tires are rated at 100psi which is rather amazing, and it feels fast with that pressure. Overall it’s a good deal. It would’ve been nice to piece a bike together but I would’ve spent double this amount.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Mongoose
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bmx bike for an adult. Lightweight and built sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Wear a helmet!!
customer_reviews.text: What i love so much, is that it's very fast!!!!! But the only thing that got on my nerves was the back tire kept pulling upwards, making the chain to pop. My legs are too powerful, i guess! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Richard Heath

customer_reviews.title: Light fast fun bmx bike
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bike to ride back and forth on my farm that was quick and simple. I grew up in the bmx scene so i wanted a bmx bike just to scratch that old itch. This is a fun bike and took me right back to the good old days. Its light easy to throw around wheelies nice. It has a REALLY well constructed frame fantastic quality build. I'm not a huge fan of the tires for gravel like I'm always on but the do work decently. Works really well for what I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Liesenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bike. Super lightweight compared to my other ones, I can carry it with one arm up the stairs. The frame is good and it was very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. Easy to assemble, I had no to make zero adjustments (although once I've put a few miles on it, I'm sure things will need to be tightened or loosened). Plus, it looks really sweet.
customer_reviews.author: caity b

customer_reviews.title: Great bike.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, fast, and great looking. Just be sure to tighten the rear wheel down pretty well, or it will walk forward and you will pop the chain constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Excellent race bike for the money. 5 stars for the amount you pay 4 stars for what you get and you have the ability to upgrade parts til its on any level you want. Good job Mongoose
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: A lot of Money for exercising a teenager
customer_reviews.text: Took way to long to be delivered The seat is way to small, I don’t even think it is the one appropriate for this bike And , just forget about the price ( way to much )
customer_reviews.author: SERENA

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the money. I would recommend getting chain tensioners. Extremely light and rides very well. Easy to assemble and very fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice Goose
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike. Kid loves it. Added some lights, it’s Jersey.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: I’m in my 40s and over 200 pounds this bike is just Awsome handles all the abuse I give it and it’s super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dont trust the sizing chart
customer_reviews.text: bike is fine but the seat sucks and is not adjustable angle wise as well as needs a longer stem, also they are way off on sizing if you are above 5'9'' make sure you get the XXL
customer_reviews.author: Jess H. Jewett

customer_reviews.title: Poor product, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this $500 bike. Had a professional bike shop assemble it. 3 weeks later my grandson went off a 6 inch curb. The crankshaft bent, the spring holding the freewheel pawls broke allowing a pawl to destroy the inside of the hub. Customer service said they would not cover replacement of any parts. Poor customer service, it took 6 tries to reach anyone at Mongoose and they required multiple pictures, multiple emails to deny any warranty coverage. DO NOT BUY ONE OF THESE LOSER BIKES!
customer_reviews.author: George B. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Made in china :(
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice bike and i would have rated it higher, but its made in china which i hate. If i buy another bike ill be making sure its made in the great ol' U.S. of A. MURICA!
customer_reviews.author: melonheads

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been racing for a long time even pro. I got the opportunity to grab one of the new Mongoose Title Elite xxl and I could not be happier. Rode the stock bike out of the box a few times and had no issues besides tightening the bars little more (my fault). Then after a full race set up this bike is in the 19lb rang, I could not be happier! Been on her most of the season and no issues! You can pay a lot more for the same quality but why! So stoked Mongoose is back in the racing game game!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne L Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: I used to race bmx as a kid. Now that I'm getting my son into it, I wanted something to ride on the track with him without spending 1000 dollars. Honestly, I'm extremely impressed with this bike. I've had very expensive bikes in the past and I feel better on this one than I had on any others! Extremely lightweight and durable. In my opinion besides the price, I would recommend this bike to anyone just because of how well made it I'd. Well done Mongoose!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cirami

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a high end bike
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble right out of the box, and hardly required any tweaking at all. Talk about an unexpected and awesome surprise! The bike itself is really light weight, and looks professional. Everything is under a layer of varnish, sleekly designed for a professional minimalist look. Literally the ONLY adjustment we made was the saddle stem height. Basic stuff. The quality really shows through in the frame, it feels high end and while we might upgrade other parts throughout the years the frame is here to stay. This bike is being used for freestyle BMX, and onto the track! It’s the perfect blend between a high-end BMX bike and a more affordable option.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Came in a box and no damage to it. Very easy to assemble took me less than an hour. Took it out on the road and dirt road and does great. Good grip and brakes so very happy with it all! The tires are my favorite part does great in the dirt!
customer_reviews.author: Mason

product_meta.title: Mongoose Title Elite Pro BMX Race Bike, 20-Inch Wheels, Advanced Riders, Professional-Grade Tectonic T1 Biaxial Hydroformed and Butted Aluminum Frame
feature_bullets: Capable of high-end performance – a bike designed for riders with intermediate skills all the way up to pro – the Mongoose Title Elite Pro XL BMX race bike is a level above our popular Title series. Suggested rider height is 5'7" - 6'0".

Professional-grade 6061 Tectonic T1 Biaxial Hydro formed and butted aluminum frame with 86mm BB shell, tapered headtube, 3D forged 10mm dropouts and internal cable routing. 21. 26” top tube length and frame weight of 3. 3 lbs.
The Title Elite’s drivetrain features 175mm 2-piece 24mm hollow spindle alloy cranks with a 44T alloy chain ring and BB86 press-fit sealed bottom bracket.
The wheelset features Arisen XLR8 20” tires mounted on exposure aluminum double wall rims with 10mm hollow axle sealed front hub and 16T cog sealed bearing cassette rear hub.

Aluminum linear pull brake and Radius aluminum brake levers offer precision speed control, while the 4130 chromo handlebar and fork are joined by a 50mm stem and sealed bearing headset to combine for maximum steering performance.
